Topic: Draw a string telephone between two students.
Evidence Statements: The student can illustrate a device that allows two students to communicate over a distance.
The student can correctly depict how sound travels through the string in the telephone to solve the communication problem.
The student can show that the device relies on sound, not just the string, for communication.
The student can demonstrate, through their drawing, the use of materials provided for constructing the string telephone.
The student can label parts of the device to explain how it works using sound.
The student can visually represent how the string telephone connects two students as a form of communication technology.
The student can include features in their drawing that highlight the importance of technology in communication over distances.
